title: feat(terraform): Redshift cluster template
body:
#### Summary of changes
**Asana Task:** [Migrate Redshift](https://app.asana.com/0/1200287338218380/1202711366294305)

- We have decided to use the redshift cluster due to the limitations of redshift serverless.
- At the Insurify account, we have these specs of the redshift cluster.
- Node type: dc2.large 
- Number of nodes: 16
- 1 dc2.large= 2 CPU = 2*16 = 32 CPU  and storage = 2.6 TB
**- Cost = 2888 USD**


Now we have decided to use the following:
- Node type:
- 1  ra3.xlplus= 4 CPU = 2*8 = 32 CPU  and storage = 256 TB
- Number of nodes to make it equal to 32 CPU: 8

**- Cost = 6225 USD**

This is a significant increase in cost.
Even with these specs we still have the same CPU and we are facing CPU issues at the original cluster.
Please provide suggestions if we have any about the specs.

title: feat(terraform): Migrate SFTP server to insurify-data account
body:
#### Summary of changes
**Asana Task:** [Move SFTP application to the Data account](https://app.asana.com/0/1200287338218380/1202908209002390)

Currently, we have the SFTP application running two servers in the production account.

Move the application to the Insurify-Data account as it's more relevant there.

Since all reports and data buckets are in the same account, the policy could be updated as well to be more strict and allow the use only from the current (Insurify-Data) account

Plan:
- Before merging destroy the current SFTP server
- Merge the PR 
- Terraform will create a new server in Insurify-data account.
- Update the NS values of sftp.insurify.com in the insurify-account to point to the new hosted zone created in the Insurify-data account.
- Infra VPC association with the newly created private hosted zone  (sftp.insurify.com) in Insurify-data account
